post_text:
Congrats on your K.a.A.T. card Holden!

"K.a.A.T, which stands for Kindness at All Times, is happening at Sunol Glen this year! Our school is committed to providing a caring and kind environment for all students and is dedicated to promoting good will, empathy, and kindness. KaAT cards are given to students for treating others with respect and kindness ‚Äì the cards may be kept or turned into the office for monthly special drawings.

#WhoIsNext #KaAT #SunolGlen

post_text: Hey, Sunol Glen parents! Take a look at this article talking about CPR-7 on news.heart.org ‚Äì Sunol Glen students have trained the most people each year for six years. Ellie Chan (from Sunol Glen) holds the county record with 110 and Noelani Takei's picture is included as having trained the second highest amount this school year. Way to go!

post_text:
Geek Squad takes flight:
Working on their Tech Challenge project, Geek Squad students made a break through today after building an aircraft that will deliver a payload while clearing a course distance that includes height obstacles, finally reaching a target. They will work through the coming weekend as they prepare for the main event at the San Jose Tech Museum on 4/23/16.

#WishThemLuck
#PrinciplesOfFlight #TechChallenge #GeekSquadTakesOff

post_text:
Everyone is Googley-eyed for Chromebooks!

Check out these two short videos: Our first video depicts our Geek Squad elective students in action, setting up our campus with 1:1 Chromebooks ‚Äì they were a HUGE help and became tech experts in the process! Watch it here: https://youtu.be/nsAbMDk9D2E

And what happens after the new tech arrives in the classroom? To find out, watch the second short video, "Chromebooks in the Classroom", where our 2nd and 3rd Graders are overjoyed with just how much they can accomplish when new tech tools are added to the mix. Watch it here: https://youtu.be/J8v5zQsb4U0

#SunolGlen #CDIComputers #Chromebooks #GeekSquad #GAFE

post_text:
"I like being on stage and acting, it's really fun and a great experience. It's really exhilarating to be up in front of people and show them another side of you they didn't know you had." ~ Ireland, 8th grade student.

"Song of the Nightingale: The Tales of Hans Christian Andersen," will be performed this evening by the Sunol Glen 6th-8th grade theater elective at 6:30pm in the auditorium, free admission for all.

Please come see this amazing play and the students who have put so much work into this production, as lead by theater director Kenn Adams!

post_text:
Today, 7th grade students had the opportunity to dissect a cow's eye as part of a hands-on science lesson on Eye and Light, taught by teacher Suzette Takei.

"I think getting to experience something hands-on is more educational for the student. A cow's eye, in reality, is more complex than a simple diagram," ~Rowan, 7th grade student at Sunol Glen, sharing her thoughts on the lesson.
text:

Come to the best fundraising event in town and support one of Sunol Glen's own cherished students: Dillon O'Leary.

The upcoming event is being held Sunday, Aug. 30, 3:30pm-7pm at Barone's Restaurant in Pleasanton ‚Äì and it's shaping up to be quite the evening. A night of celebration, community, hope and healing, we are all #DillonStrong, coming together in support of one of our Sunol Glen families. We cannot wait to have you home Dillon!

For tickets, call Bree Gomes at 510-557-2079, or email blgomes@yahoo.com. Please review the flier included here for more information.

#SunolGlen #OLearyFamily

post_text:
**OPEN HOUSE THIS THURSDAY**
This Thursday, May 25th, is our Annual Open House - which is an excellent time for families to come & spend time in their child's classroom. Kicking off our Open House event, our fabulous school band will be performing their Spring Concert at 6pm - be sure to come on by to hear their amazing musicality!

Also during this event, we will be hosting a ONE DAY ONLY BOOK FAIR! Our students love to go to the Book Fair and purchase books, so be sure to stop by the library during Open House!

Also, we will be featuring the Famous Mr. Hoxie Tri-Tip Dinner - if you have not tried Mr. Hoxie's Tri-Tip yet, you do not know what you are missing - it is truly a culinary delight! Both the Book Fair and Tri-Tip Dinner are fund raiser events that support school activities and we appreciate your participation!

‚Ä¢ 5:15pm: Tri-Tip Dinner
‚Ä¢ 6:00pm: Band Performance
‚Ä¢ 7:00pm: Classroom Visits

We hope to see you there!

Both the Book Fair and Tri-Tip Dinner are fund raiser events that support school activities and we appreciate your participation!

‚Ä¢ 5:15pm: Tri-Tip Dinner
‚Ä¢ 6:00pm: Band Performance
‚Ä¢ 7:00pm: Classroom Visits

We hope to see you there!

post_text: Sunol Glen School was well-represented at the 2015 National History Bee Finals in Kentucky this past weekend - excellent work by Sunol students Joshua Replogle (7th Grade), Geoffrey Pott (7th Grade) and Arjun Bothra (6th Grade)!!

post_text:
Attention Sunol Glen Families and Guests:

During the month of April (4/6 thru 4/24), you will need to plan for more time in your schedule to access our school site, as roadwork will be conducted along Main Street, our primary access street to the school. Hours of work will take place between 7am to 6pm - everyone will be affected. There will be NO PARKING along Main Street during this time.

Please take a look at the attached flyer of information regarding more details about this project, or stay up to date by visiting:
http://sfwater.org/index.aspx?page=678

Thank you all!

post_text:
Meet Sunol Glen School's 2015 History Bee Team.

Our team (L-R):
Arjun Bothra (6th grade), Josh Replogle (7th grade), and Geoffrey Pott (7th grade), competed in a Regional Tournament in January, beating Piedmont Hills High School, and qualified them for the Middle School National Championships held in May in Kentucky.

Please help support this amazing team of Sunol Glen students by checking out their GoFundMe page, where you may donate, comment or just help spread the word as they make their way to Kentucky for the Championships: http://www.gofundme.com/lmha74

"The more you know about the past, the better prepared you are for the future."
~ Theodore Roosevelt

post_text:
What do Sunol Glen Teachers do when they're not teaching our students? We all know our teachers are fabulous and fascinating in the classroom, and probably still spend plenty of "spare" time thinking about their students!

Tell us and NPR about the Secret Lives of Teachers ‚Äì maybe yourself, your own teacher or a teacher you know. Or post your own Secret Life on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram at #secretteachers. NPR is on Twitter at @npr_ed. Find NPR on Facebook or you can drop us an email at NPREd@npr.org.

post_text:
SGS Middle School teacher, Suzette Takei, honored today by the Oakland Raiders with an Academic Honors Award. This award recognizes local students and educators for their academic achievements and positive impact within the community. Recipients of this distinguished award are advocates for higher education and role models both inside and out of the classroom.
#RaiderNation #Takei #SunolGlenSchool

post_text:
The Garden is blooming at Sunol Glen! Our students recently enjoyed a school-wide Garden Day, harvesting lettuce, tomatoes, potatoes, squash and peppers for a tasty salad prepped at new work stations. Resident Silkie chickens Isabelle, Goldie, Stripe and Peeps visited with students beneath large oak trees. Thank you Sunol Glen Garden Co-Chairs Jennifer Rampton, Alisa & Abran Dreyfus for cultivating our students hearts and minds!

#EdibleEducation #SunolGlenSchool #StayGreen

post_text:
Save the Date!
The Sunol Parents of Special Needs Committee meets on Tuesday September 16 @6:30pm. The meeting will be in the Thrivent Financial Building (next to the Little Brown Church) on Kilkare Rd. Guest Speaker is Robin Spindler, Director of Student Services at Las Lomitas Elementary School District (Menlo Park) and Sunol resident. Our topic "Parents Rights - what you need to know".
RSVP to vic.cloutier@gmail.com.
Please share.....
All welcome even if your kids are in High School and you just want to meet other parents. You are not alone!!

Special Needs Parents: Here are some great meetings coming up that are hosted by the Tri Valley SELPA. Feel free to attend. Or pass along. We'll cover these in our first meeting in September at Sunol Glen.....

SEPTEMBER 24, 2014, @ Dublin USD, 6:30-8:00PM, Board Room
Jesse Saperstein - motivational speaker (author of "Atypical: Life with Asperger's in 20 1/3 Chapters" and "Getting A Life with Asperger's Lessons Learned on the Bumpy Road to Adulthood")

OCTOBER 22, 2014, @ Dublin USD, 6:30-8:30PM, Board Room
Informed, Empowered Parents: IEP Process with Advocate Renee Lamborn

NOVEMBER 13, 2014, @ Dublin USD, 6:30-8:00PM, Board Room
Meet the Special Education Directors, panel and Q & A

post_text: Do you have a child with special needs? Not sure what to do? We have answers for you. Sunol Glen now is now forming its own CAC group. The Community Advisory Committee provides information, resources and workshops for parents. If you'd like to join or get more information, the CAC group is being formed by Vic Cloutier at vic.cloutier@gmail.com. Spread the word.....
